track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Welcome to the 9th edition of HourRank! It's a one-hour rated contest with 3/4 algorithmic challenges. Are you fast and accurate enough to win it?
The author for this round is Kevinsogo!
primary_contest.name: HourRank 9

model.name: Fair Rations

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

N = gets.strip.to_i
B = gets.strip
B = B.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n = read n_temp :: Int
    b_temp <- getLine
    let b = map read $ words b_temp :: [Int]

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: How many loaves of bread will it take to feed your subjects?
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          N_t (read-line) 
          N (Integer/parseInt N_t) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          B_temp (read-line) 
          B_t (split B_temp #"\s+") 
          B (map #(Integer/parseInt %) B_t) 
        ]
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    B = read_array(N,"~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
N = io.read("*number", "*l")
B = {}
B_temp = io.read()
B_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(B_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	B[B_i] = token
	B_i = B_i + 1
end
